link.synopsis: Funnyman Tim Conway stars in this hilarious double dose of comedy classics that features clueless clods trying to conquer the outdoors, beginning with the return of hapless sportsman Dorf. First, Dorf and his wife embark on a goofy fishing excursion. Then, Conway teams with Harvey Korman, his co-star from "The Carol Burnett Show," to portray a duo trying -- and failing miserably -- to have a successful camping vacation.

link.synopsis: In this hilarious comedy based in part on the sci-fi cult favorite Killers from Space, the devious Dr. Doug Fartin (Peter Graves) makes it his mission to stop gay men from infiltrating the military. But soon, he turns out to prefer men himself, thanks to the machinations of extraterrestrials, and his colleagues must find a way to "straighten" him out. But is that possible?

link.synopsis: The Baberellas, an all-female band, take off on an outrageous space escapade when a nasty extraterrestrial conspires to steal all the world's sexual power in hopes of wiping out all life on Earth to promote her television show. Along the way, the ladies must face a conniving and beautiful queen named Sartanika (Shauna O'Brien), who possesses a powerful secret weapon. Chuck Cirino directs and co-writes this sci-fi comedy.

link.synopsis: Sometimes, the road to true love can be labyrinthine; just ask the two lovers featured in this romantic comedy (not to be confused with the other film about a Greek nuptial) who end up with each other only after their respective partners dump them and they wind up living across the hall from each other. Before long, they discover they have much more in common than an address.

link.synopsis: Bogus priests Robert De Niro and Sean Penn are really escaped convicts who haven't got a prayer of sidestepping a police blockade and making it across the U.S.-Canadian border -- unless they manage to successfully pass themselves off as clergymen. Demi Moore joins forces with these wayward men of the cloth in this hilarious crime-caper comedy scripted by David Mamet and directed by Neil Jordan.

link.synopsis: Black Entertainment Television presents a glimpse into the life and work of comedian Jamie Foxx, who broke into sketch comedy (and America's consciousness) on Keenan Ivory Wayan's widely popular variety show "In Living Color" in the 1990s. Foxx subsequently starred in his own sitcom, "The Jamie Foxx Show," and appeared in more than a dozen major motion pictures.

(His most immortal character creations are bumbling, upper-class man-about-town Bertie Wooster and Wooster's unruffled manservant, Jeeves). John Alderton and Pauline Collins (in a variety of guises) and even Wodehouse himself appear in several uproarious short skits written by the comedy master.

link.synopsis: Comedy icons Bud Abbott and Lou Costello tickle the funny bone in this hilarious quartet. In Keep 'Em Flying, the boys take to the skies with the Army Air Corps during World War II, and Ride 'Em Cowboy finds them taming the Wild West on a dude ranch. The pair travels the high seas and stumbles upon a bounty of beauties in Pardon My Sarong; and then, in Who Done It?, they hunt for a murderer while trying to make it big in show business.

link.synopsis: Prize-winning Milwaukee independent filmmaker Dude Schmitz (Mark Borchardt) desperately needs money. After blowing an opportunity to interview the real Britney Spears, Dude hatches a scheme to make some quick cash using Britney look-alike Angel Benton (Robert Stephens). Lured by the promise of meeting his idol, Angel agrees to pose as her for a series of road-trip-style interviews in this delightfully campy comedy.

Cameraman: The Life and Work of Jack Cardiff

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, a young pregnant woman named Marga (Emma Suarez) is grieving the loss of her husband in a car accident. When her baby is born, she decides to reinvent her life after meeting a gay man named Inaki (Juan Diego Botto). Immediately, the two forge a special bond as friends, but they soon find there's more to their relationship than just friendship in this film from directors Alfonso Albacete and David Menkes.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Die Without Telling Me Where You're Going
The Other Side of the Bed
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love
The Map of Sex and Love

link.synopsis: This indie comedy stars Bradford Tatum as Caleb, a talented sculptor who's given an atypical project by renowned filmmaker Richard Verk (Kelsey Grammer) -- to construct a model of a woman's private parts. Turned off by the job's derogatory nature, Caleb must get over his aversion in order to pay bills. Meanwhile, Caleb's friend Jason (Jason Priestly) learns that a girl he's dating is pregnant and plans to have an abortion without consulting him.
link.title: synopsis
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
Smiling Fish and Goat on Fire

link.synopsis: After hearing indirectly from an old high school girlfriend, ad executive Jack (Chris Young) journeys back in time as he pages through his school's yearbook, revisiting the romantic decisions he made in the 1950s and wondering whether he pursued the right girl. Josie Bisset co-stars as Lily, the crush he never acted on. New Line Cinema founder Robert Shaye chose a romantic comedy with a distinctly nostalgic flavor for his directorial debut.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This 1947 Charlie Chaplin movie, nominated for an Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay, stars the classic comedian as a bank teller driven to murder when he can't find a new job after losing his old one (a theme that brought Chaplin under attack for his left-wing politics). Martha Raye stars as Chaplin's foil in this dark comedy that also features Irving Bacon, Marjorie Bennett, Mady Correll and more.

link.synopsis: Heartbroken to discover that her boyfriend (Adam Lazarre-White) is planning a future without her, Nicole Taylor (Renee Goldsberry) relocates to San Francisco make a fresh start in this charming romantic comedy directed by Christine Swanson. After Nicole moves in with her best friend, she unexpectedly ends up sharing living space with temporary roomie Brian Tate (Terron Brooks) -- and they soon fall in love. Will a secret doom their relationship?

link.synopsis: This raucous comedy tracks two parallel parties as they -- and their guests -- unravel throughout the evening. The first bash begins when Scott's (Scott Speedman) parents head out for the night, to be replaced quickly by Scott's brash, rash friends bent on having a grand old time at all costs. While things quickly go downhill there, his parents aren't enjoying their soiree, either. With the drinks flowing freely, conflict floats to the surface.

link.synopsis: Marie and Bruce (Julianne Moore and Matthew Broderick) are a couple on the verge of a breakdown ... and break-up. Told with a theatrical flair, the movie chronicles the stultifying ennui, rampant dysfunction and epic frustration that is part and parcel of most relationships (especially those that have reached their nadir). Bob Balaban, Campbell Scott and Griffin Dunne co-star in this arty black comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio

Mrs. Parker and the Vicious Circle
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Meet struggling screenwriter Monkey Zetterland (Steve Antin) and his zany family in this quirky comedy by Jefery Levy. Monkey uses his obsession with an extinct subway system of L.A. as fare for his script but distractions prove to deter him. There's his soap opera star mother, his lesbian sister and her girlfriend, his hairdresser brother, his girlfriend, and a fawning neighbor. Patricia Arquette, Sofia Coppola, Sandra Bernhard and Rupert Everett co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Color of a Brisk and Leaping Day
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas

link.synopsis: Premed student Ray Aibelli (Jeremy Davies) is forced to shirk a summer internship to care for his injured mother (Alberta Watson). Ray soon finds himself drawn to her disturbingly seductive womb -- despite their shared DNA and his flirtations with an attractive high schooler (Carla Gallo). David O. Russell directs this pitch-black comedy of considerable errors, which won Independent Spirit Awards for Best First Feature and Best First Screenplay.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Out of sheer boredom, septuagenarian roommates Joe (George Burns), Al (Art Carney) and Willie (Lee Strasberg) plan a daring bank heist. But after they pull off the caper, problems begin to crop up -- beginning with the death of one of the three old codgers. Hard choices and some even tougher introspection follow as the remaining two head to Las Vegas for a wild fling in this classic comedy directed by Martin Brest.

Veda (Barret Swatek) is an unhappy beauty with male groupies; J.C. (A.J. Langer) is a sleazy chain-smoker; and Wendy (Marissa Jaret Winokur) faces snubs due to her weight. Jason Alexander as "Zamboni Phil" and Kathy Griffin as an aging rival provide extra comedy.

link.synopsis: Prepare for knockabout comedy -- Italian style -- in this three-act opera written by P. Suardon and recorded live at the Teatro di Livorno. Fritz Kobus, a wealthy and generous landowner, has sworn to remain a bachelor and cannot fathom falling in love. David, a rabbi, predicts that Fritz will be marching down the marriage aisle within a year. Who will be proved right … and wrong? Prepare for plenty of unexpected twists.

link.synopsis: In this slapstick comedy, Abbott and Costello play wrestling promoters who must travel to Algiers to bring their prize wrestler back home. But before they can catch up with him, they're chased through the Casbah and into the hands of the French Foreign Legion, where they're duped into signing up for a five-year Legion tour and make a mockery of the rigorous training. Patricia Medina co-stars as a sexy French undercover agent.

link.synopsis: Biddy, boom! Andrew Dice Clay's comedy knows no bounds. Roughly translated (is there any other way with him?), that means he's lewd, crude and often utterly hilarious. But this stand-up program demonstrates that the "Dice Man" is not for everybody. For some, he's an acquired taste -- but if you're not in the least bit timid or squeamish and don't take offense easily, Clay just might be the comedian for you.

link.synopsis: Artist Jimmy Lynch (Timothy Hutton) goes on a graffiti rampage after his injured firefighter brother (Robert Urich) is denied pension in this action-packed comedy. Lynch boldly tags his brother's nickname and badge number across New York City, angering the mayor (Robert Culp), who orders his security chief (Peter Boyle) to catch Lynch. Aided by a pretty social worker (Kim Cattrall), Lynch aims his spray can at one of the city's biggest landmarks.

link.synopsis: Based on sordid tales (are there any other kind?) from Charles Bukowski's &NFi;Love Is a Dog from Hell&NFi_;, this movie deconstructs three crucial nights over the course of 20 years in the life of bumbling antihero Harry Voss as he runs the gamut from love to defeat. In turn, Voss also progresses from childhood to acne-scared teen to alcoholic adult. A nice blend of pathos and black comedy, Crazy Love will probably offend sensitive viewers!

link.synopsis: When Todd Anderson (Storm P) is chosen as the No. 1 NBA draft pick, he realizes his life is going to change drastically. In an attempt at normality, Todd throws an old-fashioned neighborhood barbecue -- at his house located in a stuffy white section of town. It's a culture clash just waiting to explode in this laugh-out-loud comedy that co-stars Jonathan Silverman, Queen Latifah, Farrah Fawcett and Frankie Faison.

link.synopsis: Even among the competitive members of the Rat Pack, Sammy Davis Jr. shone, thanks in part to his smooth voice and soulful interpretations of song standards. It also helps that he had an innate sense of timing and was able to infuse every tune with the drama or comedy it deserved. This video includes performances of such songs as "Hey There" and "Shall We Dance."

link.synopsis: Toyia Moore, Saafir, Carl Washington and Bailey Brown star in this coming-of-age comedy about 18-year-old Valerie, whose parents leave the house in her care while they enjoy a much-needed vacation. What does Valerie do with the enormous responsibility bestowed upon her? Throw a huge party, of course! After all, it is her birthday. But as expected, disaster strikes. Can she get it together before mom and dad get back?

link.synopsis: When an out-of-control automobile hits Matthew Kang, he suffers a serious concussion. During his recovery, insult is added to injury when Kang loses his job and is dumped by his girlfriend. Through all his trials and tribulations, however, he manages to remain positive, learning a valuable lesson about life and love in the process. A semi-autobiographical comedy from director-screenwriter Daniel Yoon.

link.synopsis: This compendium of comedy classics captures some of the best banter ever to be brought on-screen. Catch Abbott driving Costello bananas, and George Burns reminding Gracie to say goodnight. Comic giants Mel Brooks, Lucille Ball, W.C. Fields, John Belushi, the Marx Brothers, Charlie Chaplin and many more play everything from a 2,000-year-old man to a modern-day samurai and much more, all in the pursuit of laughs. Hilarious outtakes are included.

link.synopsis: Writer-director Aldolpho Rollo (Steve Buscemi) struggles to get his overly long script produced. Unable to pay his rent, he's forced to shop it around and finds a buyer in fast-talking shyster Joe (Seymour Cassel), who promises to produce the film too. But Joe has his own unique ideas about "financing." Alexandre Rockwell's absurd comedy won the Grand Jury Prize at the 1992 Sundance Film Festival.

link.synopsis: In this eye-opening comedy, nice guy Bobby Deluca (Louis Mandylor) -- who's in hock to loan sharks for a tidy sum and needs to earn some quick cash -- reluctantly takes a job at a car dealership run by a surly megalomaniac (Daniel Benzali). But little does Bobby know that his chrome-domed new boss is using the vehicles on the lot to smuggle contraband. Lori Loughlin co-stars as Bobby's beautiful wife.

link.synopsis: This screwball comedy is a quasi-documentary about two hilarious con artists who fool beautiful actresses into thinking they're starring in a hit film. Far from being real directors, the two bumbling buddies are actually using a camera for the first time and have no idea how to operate it. Nonetheless, these two matchstick men manage to successfully extract money from naïve wanna-be actresses who'll do anything to be in a movie.

White), carrying on an affair with his company's CEO, Mrs. Jones (Wanda Christine). But just as his relationship with Mrs. Jones starts heating up, he meets a woman, Desiree (Kim Fields), who nabs his heart. If he continues his tryst with the boss, he'll lose Desiree for sure.

link.synopsis: Think of this film as a distaff version of Barbershop. Nora (Jennifer Lewis) runs a neighborhood hair salon where coifs are second in line to gossip, romantic problems and some cat-fighting. Besides being the boss, Nora is also a motherly figure for her employees -- Clo (Tamala Jones), Lilleana (Tatyana Ali) and Devin (Jean-Claude La Marre). Bobby Brown and Lil' Kim make cameo appearances in this hair-raising comedy.

link.synopsis: Filled with brilliant sight-gags and biting social commentary, this five-volume collection contains a variety of Charlie Chaplin's most groundbreaking short films, all of which are required viewing for any fan of the silent-film era. link.synopsis: In the mid-1970s, Uncle Floyd Vivino livened up children's television with his bizarrely hilarious version of 1950s variety shows. His series caught on, and soon, viewers realized there was genius behind this surreal entertainment melding theatre with camp, improv with situation comedy, music with wacky choreography. It also boasted memorable characters such as Eddie Slobbo and Don Goomba, caught here in some of the best episodes from the show.

Two newbie mobsters are given the task to steal a priceless &NFi;objet d'art&NFi_;. When they botch the job royally, they're soon pursued by nearly every criminal element lurking in the city, including small-time thugs, cockney crooks and martial arts-wielding Chinese triads.

link.synopsis: This 1980s comedy boasts a vintage Jim Carrey as the lackluster Bobby, a ski-racing fanatic who may be fast on the slopes but molasses-slow when it comes to women. Everything he tries fails. When he and his skier friend Jackson (Alan Thicke) travel to a resort for the World Pro-Am ski competition, Bobby decides to give dating one more go. In the meantime, Jackson must face off with his nemesis before he gets a crack at greatness.

link.synopsis: In this knockabout Spanish comedy, Sofia (Rosa Maria Sarda) gets married, builds a successful career as a pianist and is a loving mom to her children, then one day, she wakes up and realizes she's a lesbian. Sofia's three grown daughters all react to their "new" mom very differently, but neurotic sibling Elvira (Leonor Watling) takes the prize when she hits upon a scheme to break up her mother's relationship by seducing Sofia's new lover.

With Bruno as the straight man and Nino as the "dumb" half of the team, their act is based on humiliation, a circumstance that eventually leads to ill will and the team's demise. Years later, they're on the way to their reunion show, with the chasm between them as wide as ever.

Motorcycle cop Melvin White (Murray Langston) can't seem to get anything right, so the higher-ups have moved him to the night shift, where they hope he can wreak the least amount of havoc. Little do they know that what's causing Melvin's mistakes is his dream to become a comedian, an identity he adopts when he's off duty. Co-stars Linda Blair and Pat Morita.

Little does he realize that acquiring furniture is more complicated than he thought it would be. Soon, it becomes a Holy Grail-like search, with a payoff that's far more rewarding than he first anticipated.

Up-and-coming actor Elliott (Jeff Daniels) comes to New York armed with a sublease agreement for an apartment. There, he finds Paula (Patricia Heaton), an ex-dancer whose live-in love just abandoned her and her daughter (Hallie Kate Eisenberg). She refuses to vacate their home, so Elliott agrees to take them on as roommates. Soon, love blooms for the unlikely pair.

link.synopsis: This campy 1973 comedy stars Joyce Jillson as Tara, a "superchick" flight attendant who's so outrageously sexy that she literally has to fight off hordes of men who can't help but be attracted to her. Not only that, Tara has a lover in every city her airline serves. When she tires of it all, her only hope of flying under the radar is to dress like a man. But when she's ready for action, she's on the prowl! Co-stars Louis Quinn and John Carradine.
